metadata.title: CVE-2023-42669 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in Samba's "rpcecho" development server, anon-Windows RPC server used to test Samba's DCE/RPC stack elements. Thisvulnerability stems from an RPC function that can be blocked indefinitely.The issue arises because the "rpcecho" service operates with only oneworker in the main RPC task, allowing calls to the "rpcecho" server to beblocked for a specified time, causing service disruptions. This disruptionis triggered by a "sleep()" call in the "dcesrv_echo_TestSleep()" functionunder specific conditions. Authenticated users or attackers can exploitthis vulnerability to make calls to the "rpcecho" server, requesting it toblock for a specified duration, effectively disrupting most services andleading to a complete denial of service on the AD DC. The DoS affects allother services as "rpcecho" runs in the main RPC task.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-42669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
libnss-winbind - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
libpam-winbind - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
libsmbclient - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
libwbclient0 - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
python3-samba - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
registry-tools - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
samba - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
samba-common - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
samba-common-bin - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
samba-libs - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
samba-testsuite - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
smbclient - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
winbind - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.5').
